info.name: Pankhuri Backend API
info.description:
## Pankhuri Learning Management System API

**Base URL:** http://localhost:8080

**Last Updated:** November 2025

### Overview:

Complete REST API for a Learning Management System with hierarchical content structure, progress tracking, and comprehensive admin controls.

### Key Features:

- **Authentication:** Google OAuth, Phone OTP, Admin login
- **User Management:** User profiles, trainer management, role-based access
- **Content Hierarchy:** Categories → Courses → Modules → Lessons (Video/Text)
- **Progress Tracking:** Automatic calculation, lesson completion, course analytics
- **Rich Content:** Lesson descriptions (Markdown), file attachments, video integration
- **Session Management:** Multi-device sessions, secure logout
- **Admin Controls:** All CRUD operations organized in dedicated subfolders

### Collection Structure:

Endpoints are organized by resource with clear separation:
- **Public Endpoints:** At root level (GET operations, user-facing)
- **Admin Endpoints:** In "Admin" subfolders (CRUD, management operations)

### Authentication:

**Bearer Token:** Most endpoints require authentication

**Auto-saved Variables:**
- Login endpoints automatically save {{authToken}} and {{userId}}
- All requests use {{authToken}} in Authorization header
- Create operations save resource IDs (categoryId, courseId, etc.)

**Quick Auth Flow:**
1. POST /api/auth/google-verify OR /api/auth/phone
2. Token saved to {{authToken}} automatically
3. All subsequent requests authenticated

### Enum Reference:

**Gender:** male, female, other, prefer_not_to_say

**UserStatus:** active (normal), inactive (disabled), suspended (banned)

**UserRole:** user (regular), admin (full access)

**CourseLevel:** beginner, intermediate, advanced, expert

**CourseStatus:** active (published), inactive (draft), archived (hidden)

**LessonType:** video (video content), text (article/markdown)

**LessonStatus:** draft (WIP), published (live, counts for progress), archived (hidden)

**ModuleStatus:** draft, published, archived

**VideoStatus:** draft, processing, published, failed

### Progress System:

**How it works:**
- Tracks individual lesson completion (with video timestamps)
- Auto-calculates course progress: (completed / total published) × 100
- Only PUBLISHED lessons count toward progress
- Triggers recalculation when admins add/delete/change lessons

**Key Behaviors:**
- Adding lessons → Progress drops for all users
- Deleting lessons → Progress entries removed, course recalculated
- Status changes → Progress updates automatically
- Certificates → NOT revoked when progress drops
- Module moves → No impact (progress is lesson-based)

**Endpoints:**
- User: Mark complete, update timestamp, view progress
- Admin: Analytics, bulk reset, recalculate all users

### Review System:

**How it works:**
- One review per user per course (enforced by unique constraint)
- Rating: Required, integer 1-5 stars
- Review Text: Optional, max 1000 characters
- Cached statistics: averageRating and totalReviews stored in Course table
- Auto-recalculates: Course stats update on every review create/update/delete

**Key Features:**
- Upsert pattern: POST creates or updates existing review
- Optional auth: GET endpoints work without token (enhanced with user data when authenticated)
- Pagination: Default 10, max 50 per page
- Sorting: newest, oldest, highest, lowest
- User separation: Authenticated user's review shown first in list
- Rating distribution: 1-5 star breakdown with counts and percentages

**Endpoints:**
- Public: Browse reviews, view stats (no auth required)
- Authenticated: Create, update, delete own review
- Admin: Delete any review (moderation)

### Content Hierarchy:

```
Category (e.g., "Yoga")
  └─ Course (e.g., "Beginner Yoga")
      ├─ Direct Lesson (moduleId = null)
      └─ Module (e.g., "Introduction")
          └─ Lesson (video or text)
              ├─ Description (Markdown, one-to-one)
              └─ Attachments (PDFs, images, docs)
```

**Important:** Every lesson has courseId. moduleId is optional (null for direct lessons).

### API Organization:

**14 Main Sections:**
1. Health Check
2. Authentication (Google, Phone, Admin)
3. Users (profile operations)
4. Trainers (Public) - Browse trainers
5. Admin - User Management
6. Admin - Trainer Management
7. Categories (public + Admin subfolder)
8. Courses (public + Admin subfolder)
9. Course Reviews (public GET + authenticated CRUD + admin moderation)
10. Modules (public + Admin subfolder)
11. Lessons (public + Admin with Descriptions/Attachments subfolders)
12. Sessions (user + admin)
13. Progress Tracking (user + Admin subfolder)
14. Videos (Admin subfolder - all admin-only)

### Collection Variables:

**Auto-saved on creation:**
- authToken - JWT authentication token
- userId - Current user ID
- trainerId - Trainer profile ID
- categoryId - Category ID
- courseId - Course ID
- moduleId - Module ID
- lessonId - Lesson ID
- videoId - Video ID
- attachmentId - Attachment ID
- reviewId - Review ID (for admin moderation)

### Quick Start Guide:

**For Frontend Developers:**
1. Import collection into Postman
2. Set {{baseUrl}} = http://localhost:8080
3. Login with /api/auth/google-verify
4. Browse public endpoints (GET operations at root)
5. For admin features, check "Admin" subfolders

**For Testing:**
1. Health Check → Verify server running
2. Admin Login → Get admin token
3. Create test data (Category → Course → Module → Lesson)
4. Test progress tracking
5. Browse user-facing endpoints

### Important Notes:

- **Port:** Server runs on 8080 (not 3000)
- **Progress:** Only published lessons count
- **Cascading:** Deleting parent deletes children (use with caution)
- **Sequences:** Use bulk update for drag-and-drop reordering
- **Descriptions:** Support full Markdown formatting
- **Attachments:** Upload files to storage first, then save metadata
- **Admin Access:** Clearly separated in subfolders for easy identification

request.description: Update FCM token for the current session. Use this when the device FCM token refreshes or changes. The old token is automatically replaced in the session - no manual cleanup needed. Max 2 active sessions per user are enforced automatically.

response.name: Update FCM Token - Success

request.description: Logout from current session. Deletes the current session and automatically removes the associated FCM token. User remains logged in on other devices.

response.name: Logout Current Session - Success

request.description: Logout from all sessions (all devices). Deletes all user sessions and automatically removes all associated FCM tokens. Use this for 'Sign out everywhere' functionality.

response.name: Logout All Sessions - Success

request.description: Get paginated reviews for a course. Optional authentication - if authenticated, user's own review is separated and returned first. Returns reviews with user details, rating, review text, and timestamps.

response.name: Get Course Reviews

request.description: Get review statistics for a course (public endpoint). Returns: averageRating, totalReviews, and ratingDistribution (1-5 star breakdown with counts and percentages).

response.name: Get Course Review Stats

request.description: Create a new review or update existing review (upsert). One review per user per course. Rating is required (1-5 integer). Review text is optional (max 1000 characters). Automatically recalculates course averageRating and totalReviews.

response.name: Create or Update Review

request.description: Update your existing review. Must have already created a review. Rating is optional (keeps existing if not provided). Review text is optional. Automatically recalculates course rating cache.

response.name: Update Review

request.description: Delete your own review for a course. Automatically recalculates course averageRating and totalReviews. Cannot delete other users' reviews (use admin endpoint).

response.name: Delete Review

request.description: Admin-only endpoint to delete any review by reviewId. Use this for moderation purposes (spam, inappropriate content, etc.). Automatically recalculates course rating cache.
Create a new module (Admin/Trainer)
Update module (Admin/Trainer)
Delete module (Admin/Trainer). Cannot delete if module has lessons.
Update multiple module sequences at once
Update module status (draft/published/archived). Set updateLessons=true to also update all lessons in the module.
Recalculate and update module duration from its lessons
Get all modules for a course with lessons

                    "lessonId": "cmildfvqb002pvya8cq9g2drz",
                    "content": "# Essential Nutrients for Pregnancy\n\n## Macronutrients\n\n### Protein\n- **Daily Need:** 75-100g\n- **Sources:** Lean meats, eggs, dairy, legumes, nuts\n- **Benefits:** Supports baby's growth and maternal tissue expansion\n\n### Carbohydrates\n- **Daily Need:** 175-210g\n- **Sources:** Whole grains, fruits, vegetables\n- **Benefits:** Primary energy source\n\n### Healthy Fats\n- **Daily Need:** Include omega-3s daily\n- **Sources:** Fish, nuts, seeds, avocado\n- **Benefits:** Brain and eye development\n\n## Key Micronutrients\n\n### Folic Acid (Folate)\n- **Daily Need:** 600 mcg\n- **Critical for:** Neural tube development\n- **Sources:** Leafy greens, fortified grains, citrus\n\n### Iron\n- **Daily Need:** 27 mg\n- **Critical for:** Blood production\n- **Sources:** Red meat, spinach, fortified cereals\n\n### Calcium\n- **Daily Need:** 1000 mg\n- **Critical for:** Bone and teeth development\n- **Sources:** Dairy, fortified plant milk, leafy greens\n\n### Vitamin D\n- **Daily Need:** 600 IU\n- **Critical for:** Calcium absorption, immune function\n- **Sources:** Sunlight, fortified dairy, fatty fish\n\n## Hydration\n\nDrink 8-10 glasses of water daily. body.raw:
{
    "textContent": "# Welcome to the Yoga Fundamentals Course

This comprehensive lesson will guide you through the essential principles of yoga practice, perfect for beginners and those looking to deepen their understanding.

## What You'll Learn

- **Foundation Poses**: Master basic asanas including Mountain Pose, Downward Dog, and Child's Pose
- **Breathing Techniques**: Learn Ujjayi breath and its calming benefits
- **Alignment Principles**: Understand proper body mechanics to prevent injury
- **Mindfulness Practice**: Connect breath with movement

## Course Materials

Please refer to the attached PDF guide and reference chart in the attachments section below.

## Prerequisites

No prior yoga experience required! All you need is:
- Comfortable clothing
- A yoga mat or soft surface
- An open mind and willingness to learn

## Useful Resources

- [Yoga Alliance - Beginner's Guide](https://www.yogaalliance.org/learn)
- [Scientific Benefits of Yoga](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3193654/)
- [Recommended Props Guide](https://www.yogajournal.com/yoga-101/props/)

## Practice Schedule

For best results, practice this sequence 3-4 times per week, allowing at least one rest day between sessions.

---

_Remember: Yoga is a personal journey. Listen to your body and move at your own pace._

💡 **Pro Tip**: Keep a yoga journal to track your progress and insights!"
}

request.description: Create or update lesson description (upsert). Supports rich text with Markdown formatting, links, lists, headings, bold/italic text. Perfect for detailed explanations like YouTube descriptions. One-to-one relation - replaces existing description if present.
Delete lesson description permanently. The lesson itself remains intact. Use this when you want to remove detailed description but keep the lesson's short description field.

exec: // Auto-save attachment ID to collection variable

request.description:
Add attachment to lesson (upload file to storage first, then save metadata here). Type is auto-detected from mimeType:
- application/pdf → pdf
- image/* → image
- application/msword, application/vnd.* → document
- application/zip, application/x-zip* → zip
- other → other

Sequence auto-increments if not provided. fileSize in bytes.
Example: Add image attachment (PNG/JPG/GIF/WebP). Type will be auto-detected as 'image' from mimeType.
Example: Add document attachment (Word/Excel/PowerPoint). Type will be auto-detected as 'document' from mimeType.
Get single attachment details by ID. Useful for download links or preview functionality.
Update attachment metadata. Can update title, fileUrl, fileName, fileSize, mimeType, or sequence. Type is re-detected from new mimeType if changed.
Delete a specific attachment permanently. Does not delete the actual file from storage - handle that separately in your frontend/storage service.
Update multiple attachment display orders at once. Useful for drag-and-drop reordering in UI. All attachment IDs must belong to the same lesson.
Delete all attachments for a lesson at once. Useful when resetting lesson materials. Does not delete actual files from storage.

body.raw:
{
    "courseId": "{{courseId}}",
    "moduleId": null,
    "textContent": "# Yoga Philosophy

Yoga is an ancient practice that combines physical postures, breathing exercises, and meditation to promote physical, mental, and spiritual well-being.

## The Eight Limbs of Yoga

1. **Yama** (Moral disciplines) - Non-violence, truthfulness, non-stealing, celibacy, non-possessiveness
2. **Niyama** (Positive duties) - Cleanliness, contentment, austerity, self-study, surrender
3. **Asana** (Postures) - Physical poses to prepare body for meditation
4. **Pranayama** (Breath control) - Breathing exercises to control life force
5. **Pratyahara** (Withdrawal of senses) - Directing attention inward
6. **Dharana** (Concentration) - Single-pointed focus
7. **Dhyana** (Meditation) - Uninterrupted flow of concentration
8. **Samadhi** (Enlightenment) - State of bliss and union

## Benefits of Regular Practice

- Improved flexibility and strength
- Better posture and balance
- Reduced stress and anxiety
- Enhanced mental clarity
- Better sleep quality

> _"Yoga is the journey of the self, through the self, to the self."_ - Bhagavad Gita",
    "title": "Understanding Yoga Philosophy",
    "slug": "understanding-yoga-philosophy",
    "description": "A comprehensive guide to the philosophical foundations of yoga, including the Eight Limbs and core principles",
    "sequence": 2,
    "estimatedReadTime": 10,
    "isFree": false,
    "isMandatory": true,
    "status": "published",
    "metadata": {
        "difficulty": "beginner",
        "language": "English",
        "topics": ["philosophy", "eight limbs", "meditation", "principles"]
    }
}

Understanding these changes will help you adapt your yoga practice safely and effectively.\n\n### First Trimester Changes\n- Hormonal shifts causing fatigue and nausea\n- Breast tenderness and enlargement\n- Increased blood volume\n- Subtle changes in balance\n\n### Second Trimester Changes\n- Growing belly and shift in center of gravity\n- Loosening of ligaments due to relaxin hormone\n- Increased energy levels\n- Back pain may begin\n\n### Third Trimester Changes\n- Significant weight in the front affecting posture\n- Shortness of breath as baby pushes on diaphragm\n- Swelling in feet and ankles\n- Preparation for labor\n\n## How Yoga Helps\n\nPrenatal yoga is specifically designed to:\n- Strengthen muscles that support pregnancy\n- Improve flexibility and prepare for childbirth\n- Reduce stress and promote relaxation\n- Connect with your baby\n- Build community with other expecting mothers\n\n## Safety First\n\nAlways remember:\n- Avoid lying flat on your back after the first trimester\n- Don't overstretch - your ligaments are looser\n- Stay hydrated\n- Stop if you feel dizzy, short of breath, or experience pain\n- Modify poses as your body changes\n\nYour journey is unique. Honor your body and its wisdom.", "estimatedReadTime": 15, "createdAt": "2025-11-30T07:00:55.902Z", "updatedAt": "2025-11-30T07:00:55.902Z" }, "lessonDescription": { "id": "cmildfucb001cvya87avgtkyu", "lessonId": "cmildfu5e0018vya89uoqvkki", "textContent": "
